name: Consejo General del Trabajo Social
memberOrga: Spanish Associations of Social Workers - www.cgtrabajosocial.es/colegios
goal:
General Council of Social Work represents 36 Spanish Professional Associations of Social Workers. It is responsible for the professional practice management in its jurisdiction, to ensure the professional prestige and to require duties properly to the Professional Associations and its members.
It is a public law corporation protected by the law and recognised by the State, with competence in the following areas:

- Register of social workers
- Representation of the profession in the national and international levels.
- Organisation and regulation of the professional practice
- Function of control of training and academic contents of university degree, which are the basis for the official recognition of the professional practice.
- Issue, receive all kinds of certifications and reports, specifically those concerning the professional suitability or certificates on professional status.
- Disciplinary proceedings / notification of sanctions or disqualification proceedings for the professional practice.
- Deontological control of the professional and good practices.
- Regulation of the migratory flows of nurses both inside and outside the EU.
interests: Competition, Development, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Youth

Social affairs, education, employment, ageing, children, youth employment, family, social protection, poverty and social exclusion, Europe 2020, migration, health, human rights, minimum income, European Social Fund, European Globalisation Adjustment Fund (EGF), Fund for European Aid to the Most Deprived (FEAD) EU Programme for Employment and Social Innovation (EaSI).
